comments: If you've never used Python before don't be discouraged in the first couple weeks when it can be challenging. Just take a deep breath and step back from the problem, reassess, ask for help, and just keep trying new approaches.
It would be better to not take the course when you don't have any background in CS.

This class is an excellent introduction to natural language processing aspects of Python and has opened the door to many new avenues of research that I did not think I would be in a position to do starting out. I have finished it with a good understanding not just of the course material but of the wider questions surrounding the applicability of the methods, their limitations and their strengths.
This course will make digital methods accessible.

Donald provides very detailed instructions and useful in-class exercises for various topics and applications of digital methods. The workload is moderate, and not too much programming skills are required in this course. Highly recommended to students of Chinese studies in both humanities and social sciences.
If you are working materials related to modern China or pre-modern China, this course is highly recommended!!!!
